attachments.fallback: [April 8th, 2021 1:28 PM] paresh2047: is there another package apart from Interpolations.jl which offers splines? Ideally one which can work with Flux
attachments.text: is there another package apart from Interpolations.jl which offers splines? Ideally one which can work with Flux

text: There are some upsampling functions in Flux now, and we have a GSoC out there for people who want to see more image processing become differentiable.

elements.text: There are some upsampling functions in Flux now, and we have a GSoC out there for people who want to see more image processing become differentiable.

text: What’s your use case? You might want to open an issue on Flux

elements.text: What’s your use case? You might want to open an issue on Flux

text: there is already an issue on flux and I see you have commented on it now :smile: .

elements.text: there is already an issue on flux and I see you have commented on it now

text: my usecase requires more than upsampling unfortunately. But the most specific description of what I want to do is fit the spline parameters using flux. This will enable me to mix a lot of models together using flux.

elements.text: my usecase requires more than upsampling unfortunately. But the most specific description of what I want to do is fit the spline parameters using flux. This will enable me to mix a lot of models together using flux.

text: That sounds interesting. I'd love to hear more as you progress

elements.text: That sounds interesting. I'd love to hear more as you progress

text: I mean... that's the whole point of differentiable programming, right? I am writing a Pluto notebook, I guess I can host it somewhere and share it here.

elements.text: I mean... that's the whole point of differentiable programming, right? I am writing a Pluto notebook, I guess I can host it somewhere and share it here.

text: Absolutely! I want to hear more about dP projects in general too

elements.text: Absolutely! I want to hear more about dP projects in general too

text: Dierckx.jl links to a fairly standard splines C library, but it won't accept new types.

elements.text: Dierckx.jl links to a fairly standard splines C library, but it won't accept new types.
